newsitem.title: FRANCE: Accor falls on disappointing H1 results.
newsitem.headline: Accor falls on disappointing H1 results.

text.p: Shares in hotels group Accor fell on Tuesday as its first-half net attributable profit disappointed, traders said.
The stock was down 2.73 percent at 642 francs on 195,601 shares, at 0930 GMT.
Broker Oddo said the operating profit plus the financial result plus the equity consolidated income of 441 million francs was sharply lower than its expected 722 million francs.
Another French broker said Accor had sharp falls in its average room rate -- the average revenue from its rooms -- in the first and second quarters but there was a rebound in the third.
But the appointment of Jean-Marc Espalioux as a senior executive was seen as "a key change in management" which would bring along a "fresh pair of eyes", the second broker said.
Espalioux was already on Accor's board and comes from utilities company Cie Generale des Eaux.
